ygData.subject: Re: Educating the masses
ygData.msgSnippet: Selos, SoW, SoC, Consonant Chain, Snare, Enstill, Grasping Roots etc,  all cancel out like effects, first in, first out. So, Selos will cancel root for any
ygData.messageBody:
Selos, SoW, SoC, Consonant Chain, Snare, Enstill, Grasping Roots etc, all
cancel out like effects, first in, first out.

So, Selos will cancel root for any member in the party, while leaving the
root icon in place for the normal duration.

You can also break yourself out of root indoors, by casting Consonant Chain
on yourself. Sure, you move *very* slow, but at least you're moving..;)

I've also blasted myself off a ledge while rooted, using Bellow. Bought me
enough time to escape as the mobs ran around and down to get at me again,
and hurt less than the pounding they were giving me.

----- Original Message -----
From: Randy Varnell <rvarnell@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>; EQBards <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 22, 1999 4:33 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Educating the masses


>From: Randy Varnell <rvarnell@...>
>
>Hello!
>
>
>>Last night Roop (a fellow bard) and I were grouping with a party in
Highhold
>>Pass fighting orcs. After one particular tough battle, one of the party
>>members stated that the fight would have been a lot easier if he hadn't
been
>>rooted the entire battle. I then told him that had he informed the group
>>that he was rooted, Roop or I could have easily broken him free with
Selo's.
>
>
>Actually, I thought that Selo's only broke a root spell on the bard who
>sings it, not on the party members. Any confirmation on this?
>
>Also, you're absolutely right about multiple bards in a group. Also, an
>entire group of bards is pretty interesting in a fight when you get to the
>lvl 15 and above range. You MUST coordinate your songs, but if you take the
>time to do so, you can do some amazing things in combat.
>
>One fun thing to try with a group of two or three bards is to learn how to
>stack CoD. You CAN do this, but you have to time it so that the pulses come
>at slightly different times. If you work it right, your opponent will wince
>until he dies.
>
